subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: ... When he wrote meat ?  Like the sound in met , but prolonged.  Later this sound merged either with the sound of met (as in head ) or with the sound of
messageBody:
Paul Tremblay scripsit:

> Interesting. What sound was Shakespeare writing when he wrote /E:/, etc?

When he wrote "meat"? Like the sound in "met", but prolonged. Later
this sound merged either with the sound of "met" (as in "head") or
with the sound of "meet" (as in "meet").

--
John Cowan <cowan@...> http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
Charles li reis, nostre emperesdre magnes,
Set anz totz pleinz ad ested in Espagnes.

Paul Tremblay scripsit:

> Interesting. What sound was Shakespeare writing when he wrote /E:/, etc?

When he wrote "meat"?  Like the sound in "met", but prolonged.  Later
this sound merged either with the sound of "met" (as in "head") or
with the sound of "meet" (as in "meet").
